alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 12:47AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Slow-moving thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Hancock, southeastern Van Buren, southwestern Lee, northern Clark and northeastern Scotland Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1245 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking slow-moving thunderstorms along a line extending from Memphis to near Colmar. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Rainfall amounts around 1 inch have fallen and an additional 1 to 2 inches of rain are possible. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If the heavy rain continues, a flash flood warning may be needed.
